alert.note: Alert for Jones; Lyman; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 1:58PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation this afternoon into early this evening and blowing snow tonight. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Stanley, Jones and Lyman Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ Wednesday to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes this week. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
